SEARCH
Package com.example.quacks_app

Class NotificationHandler

java.lang.Object
com.example.quacks_app.NotificationHandler
public class NotificationHandler extends Object

This class is responsible for instantiating and managing system notifications for this app. It creates the channel that the notifications will be broadcast to, the notifications themselves, and ensures notification permissions are confirmed and acknowledged.

Note that due to the nature of permission requests in applications, there is some necessary functionality that only exists in activities that employ this class, that handle said functionality on this class's behalf.

  • Constructor Details

    • NotificationHandler

      public NotificationHandler()
      The constructor for the handler. All it does is set the first notification ID and define the notification list.

  • Method Details

    • createChannel

      public static void createChannel(android.content.Context context)
      Creates the notification channel that notifications will be broadcast to. This channel is called Events Channel, and is "A channel for sending updates about events you expressed interest in.", you as in the user.
      Parameters:
      context - - the activity that this channel is being created in.

    • sendNotification

      public void sendNotification(android.content.Context context, String title, String messageShort, int icon)
      This method creates and emits a notification that has a small, always visible message. The notification is associated with the created notification channel, so there must be an existing channel before this method can work. Additionally, there is a suppressed SecurityException for when a notification is sent, specifically in "notificationManagerCompat.notify(newNotifID, builder.build());", where there is a worry by the system that a notification may be sent without a check of the proper permissions. These are intentionally suppressed because in a given activity, this method is never called unless notifications are allowed in the first place, effectively checking for permission first before allowing any notifications to be made.
      Parameters:
      context - - The activity the notification is sent over.
      title - - The main title of the notification.
      messageShort - - The content of the notification.
      icon - - An image resource that serves as the logo for the notification.

    • sendNotificationVerbose

      public void sendNotificationVerbose(android.content.Context context, String title, String messageShort, String messageLong, int icon)
      This method creates and emits a notification that has a small, always visible message. It also contains a field for a larger/longer message that can be viewed in the system's notification tab by swiping up. The notification is associated with the created notification channel, so there must be an existing channel before this method can work. Additionally, there is a suppressed SecurityException for when a notification is sent, specifically in "notificationManagerCompat.notify(newNotifID, builder.build());", where there is a worry by the system that a notification may be sent without a check of the proper permissions. These are intentionally suppressed because in a given activity, this method is never called unless notifications are allowed in the first place, effectively checking for permission first before allowing any notifications to be made.
      Parameters:
      context - - The activity the notification is sent over.
      title - - The main title of the notification.
      messageShort - - The content of the notification.
      messageLong - - The content of the longer text portion of the notification.
      icon - - An image resource that serves as the logo for the notification.

    • askForPermission

      public static void askForPermission(android.app.Activity activity)
      This method explicitly asks for notification permission from the user, using the built-in standardized permission prompt by Android. Additionally, because these permissions were introduced on a specific version of Android, there is a check to ensure the user has an OS that is at least a specific threshold OS (the one that introduced the permissions.)
      Parameters:
      activity - - the activity that is asking for permission.

    • getNotificationForUser

      public ArrayList<Notification> getNotificationForUser(User user)
      Based on the user passed it queries for the notifications that are not delivered and adds them to an arraylist
      Parameters:
      user -
      Returns:
      an Arraylist of notifications
